author: statelayer

<@!420951281910284289> because in periods of congestion, tips would probably get pretty big. and highs fees/tips to miners can make network less secure. Also , why not ? more ETH burned = better for ETH value and security of the network

author: trent_vanepps
content: how would high fees to miners make the network less secure

author: statelayer
content: i'd rather we burn most of the tip and be able to fund more security via rewards

author: statelayer
content: since paying miners via rewards instead of tips/fees is much better for security, why not burn a significant part of the tips and possibly use that for more rewards

author: sky.cactus
content: <@311272920989040641> Burning tips will likely result is miner payments ending up extra-protocol which just makes them more opaque and increases the barrier to entry.

author: sky.cactus
content: The hope is that the vast majority of the time tips will be flat rate, and the only people setting them to anything other than flat rate will be front runners and bots.

author: statelayer
content: interesting, thank you ! Hadn't thought about extra-protocol implications

author: sky.cactus
content: Keep in mind, it isn't congestion that will cause tips to be high, it is *change* in congestion that can cause them to rise.

author: sky.cactus
content: You need to have an increase in block space demand of over 2x dn a very short period of time before increasing tips is necessary, and you need to sustain that for the tips to stay necessary.

author: sky.cactus
content: High congestion by itself won't result in excessive tips being necessary.

author: statelayer
content: well, is there a max base fee or does that increase exponentially following use of blockspace

author: sky.cactus
content: <@311272920989040641> There is no max.  It will increase until enough people are driven away.

author: statelayer
content: Great. Everything you said sounds fair to me , thank you !
